ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and construct great fortresses, hoping to live for ever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Erect palaces (thinking) that you will live for ever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and erect huge palaces as though you will live for ever,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and raise strong mansions as if you were to live forever?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And prefer strong palaces, that perhaps you may live for ever?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And do you get for yourselves Masani` as if you will live therein forever"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And you make strong fortresses that perhaps you may
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and do you take to you castles, haply to dwell forever?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And seek ye out strongholds, that haply ye may last for ever?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and erect castles hoping that you will live forever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And take ye for yourselves castles that haply ye may abide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: You set up structures as if you will be immortal,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And do ye get for yourselves fine buildings in the hope of living therein (for ever)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And do you get for yourselves palaces (fine buildings) as if you will live therein for ever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And do you take to yourselves underground reservoirs, in order to live for ever!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And you set up fortresses, hoping to live forever?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:129] And you set up structures, for [extracting] water underground, that perhaps you might, as though you will, last forever, therein and not die.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And seek ye out strongholds) houses, palaces and pools, (that haply ye may last for ever) in this worldly life? Nay, you will not last for ever!
